Description: Arsenical copper axe-head: with evenly concave sides forming a narrow waist mid-way between the butt and the cutting end. It has a slightly concave butt and angular lugs. The ends of the convex cutting edge are cusped. There are signs of wear on the edge. The piece is lightly corroded in parts. Traces left by the original haft are visible along the butt. One face bears surface irregularities produced during the casting process. The other face bears a large number of light scratches. A series of deeper incised marks on the sides may be a crude form of decoration.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (109)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
